results.title: Fear woman
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and Elspeth MacDougall
results.brief_description: A documentary about the status of women in Ghana, noting their reputation for independence. Points out that the women run a large part of the retail trade of the country, and that they are beginning to enter into areas which have power and influence.
results.description: A documentary about the status of women in Ghana, noting their reputation for independence. Points out that the women run a large part of the retail trade of the country, and that they are beginning to enter into areas which have power and influence.

results.title: Fear eats the soul = Angst essen seele auf
results.creator_credit: Tango Film, Christian Hohoff and Rainer Werner Fassbinder
results.brief_description: Fear eats the soul is prolific German director Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s unsentimental interpretation of Douglas Sirk’s “All that heaven allows”. In this tough blend of social realism and Hollywood melodrama, Fassbinder examines racism and class in the love affair between an elderly German widow (Brigitte Mira) and a young Arab immigrant (played by Fassbinder’s lover at the time El Hedi ben Salem) which is met with hostility and derision from their family and friends. Considered the leading director of the ‘new German cinema’, Fassbinder had already dealt with this subject matter in his 1970 feature “The American soldier”. Winner of the International critics prize, Cannes Film Festival 1974. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Fear and loathing in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Rhino Films, Shark Production, Laila Nabulsi, Patrick Cassavetti, Stephen Nemeth and Terry Gilliam
results.brief_description: Terry Gilliam’s surreal depiction of Hunter S. Thompson’s classic 1971 novel “Fear and loathing in Las Vegas: A savage journey into the heart of the American dream”, encapsulates sportswriter Raoul Duke (Thompson’s alter-ego) descent into a drug induced frenzy on a wild road trip with his friend and lawyer Oscar Zeta Acosta (Benicio del Toro). This story established the term ‘Gonzo journalism’ as Duke travels from California to Las Vegas to report on the Mint 400 Desert Motorcycle race, with a suitcase filled with an assortment of drugs. This illegal stash, heartily consumed, influenced the crazy antics of the bumbling duo and provided an insight into the decline of the 1960s peace and love generation. Johnny Depp’s stunning portrayal of the infamous journalist and writer, is a tour-de-force of acid trip induced hallucinations and paranoia that creates a nightmarish world filled with reptilian monsters, circus dwarfs and morphing hotel rooms. Terry Gilliam’s visually stimulating frenetic hand-held style graphically conveys confronting images of psychedelic induced episodes by the main characters who flail around in murky baths brandishing knives and picking up underage girls. The film has been described as hilarious, disturbing and magical. Guest appearances by Cameron Diaz, Toby Maguire, Harry Dean Stanton and Christina Ricci.

results.title: Fear
results.creator_credit: Image Entertainment, Brian Grazer, Ric Kidney and James Foley
results.brief_description: An intense psychological thriller about violence amongst teens starring Mark Wahlberg, Reese Witherspoon, Alyssa Milano, William Petersen and Amy Brenneman. Nicole Walker (Witherspoon) is a typical high school student who lives with her affluent and overprotective father (Petersen) and his new wife (Brenneman). Rebelling against him, Nicole sneaks out of the house with her best friend Margo (Milano) to a club, where she meets attractive bad-boy David McCall (Wahlberg in one of his first lead roles). Despite her father’s reservations about her first serious boyfriend and his questionable friends, Nicole falls head-over-heels for him and is shocked when his true possessive and violent nature is revealed. Ending their relationship, she tries to move on with her life. David has other plans, stalking Nicole and terrorising her family and friends, culminating in an attack on Nicole’s home. Set in Seattle, ‘Fear’ shows just how easy a seemingly perfect lifestyle can be altered by violence, with Nicole’s wealthy, privileged lifestyle overlapping with David’s underworld grunge life.

results.title: Fawlty Towers: Basil the Rat
results.brief_description: Manuel insists that his pet rodent is a Siberian hamster. Basil is convinced that the pet shop has conned the gullible Spaniard and sold him a rat - a fine thing to have running around the hotel when the public health inspector is also on the loose.
results.description: Manuel insists that his pet rodent is a Siberian hamster. Basil is convinced that the pet shop has conned the gullible Spaniard and sold him a rat - a fine thing to have running around the hotel when the public health inspector is also on the loose.

results.title: Fawlty Towers. the Kipper and the Corpse. Waldorf Salad,Etc.
results.brief_description: Chaos reigns as one of the guests, with complete disregard for Basil’s blood pressure, dies in his bed. Doubtless it was the kippers, (which should have been thrown out weeks ago), that did it to him. Demented and panic stricken, Basil attempts to conceal both the body and the fishy breakfast. This compilation tape also includes “Waldorf salad” and “A touch of class”.

results.title: Fawlty Towers. The Builders. The Wedding party. The Psychiatrist
results.brief_description: The Builders: There is building work required in the hotel lobby and, when Sybil’s back is turned, Basil immediately goes for the lowest quote for the job, but soon discovers why O’Reilly and his men come so cheap. “The Wedding party”: Basil’s prudish nature is outraged by what he perceives to be an outbreak of promiscuity at Fawlty Towers. As ever, he first grabs the wrong end of the stick and then proceeds to beat himself with it. “The Psychiatrist”: A young yobbo whom Sybil obviously fancies, a voluptuous Australian girl and a psychiatrist provide a hilarious series of misunderstandings and blunders by Basil.

results.title: Fawlty Towers. Hotel inspector. Germans. Touch of class
results.brief_description: The infamous Torquay hotel, “Fawlty Towers”, presided over by the eminently certifiable Basil Fawlty - played by John Cleese - is the setting for the following three hilarious episodes: “The Hotel Inspector”; “The Germans”; and “A Touch of Class”.

results.title: Faust
results.creator_credit: UFA, Erich Pommer and Friedrich W. Murnau
results.brief_description: Classic silent German cinema from the talented F.W.Murnau, 1926. “The portals of darkness are open and the shadows of the dead hunt over the earth..” opens the film with the prevailing theme of good versus evil as the devil Mephisto does a deal with alchemist Faust for his soul and potentially for dominion over the Earth - promising he will stop the plague that is rife throughout Faust’s village. Faust reneges on the arrangement choosing love - much to the delight of Archangel St. Michael. Based on the original story by Goethe. Great cinematography and effects give the film a dark foreboding and general creepiness that add to the dramatic impact of the work. This edition features orchestral soundtrack by the Olympia Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: Fatty Finn
results.creator_credit: Children's Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Finn Films, Brian Rosen and Maurice Murphy
results.brief_description: Film version of Australia’s comic strip, set in the years of the depression. Fatty is head of the neighbourhood nice guys and has a final confrontation with Bruiser Murphy and his gang of toughs. Stars Noni Hazlehurst and Bert Newton.
